q: What FEMA documents govern residential flood-barrier installation?
a: Primary reference: FEMA Technical Bulletin 3-93 (Updated 2021) on Dry Floodproofing. It outlines acceptable materials, anchoring, and inspection for non-residential and residential dry floodproofing measures.

q: How do FEMA guidelines affect local permits?
a: Municipal reviewers cross-reference TB-3 with local ordinances. Compliance accelerates approval and qualifies structures for NFIP mitigation credits.
FEMA does not certify brands directly. Certification comes through independent PE engineering demonstrating TB-3 equivalency and hydrostatic testing.

q: Are removable barriers recognized for NFIP credits?
a: Yes, when design documentation shows that barrier height meets Base Flood Elevation (BFE) minus 1 ft freeboard.

q: Where can I get compliant drawings?
a: We supply sealed drawings referencing FEMA TB-3 and ASCE 24-14, included in every installation package. See also anchor-bolt requirements.
